subject: Re: [junit] Re: one-time setup
msgSnippet: ... That would certainly be a reasonable explanation. But (he said) being totally certain that wasn t the case, I jumped into the code to prove the assumption
messageBody:
"Dave Astels " wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Eric Armstrong <eric.armstrong@s...>
> wrote:
>
> It sounds like there may be a static (i.e. class variable) somewhere
> that is persisting that setting between tests.

That would certainly be a reasonable explanation.
But (he said) being totally certain that wasn't the case, I jumped
into the code to prove the assumption invalid, whereupon I was
immediately horrified to discover that the error handler object
was, indeed, declared as a static variable.

And it seemed like such a good idea, at the time!

Thanks much, you guys.
(Anyone know of a good egg cleaner?)
